## Content Needed (How-To Guide Style)

### 1. Track Research Questions (~60-80 lines)

**Recipe: Organize research hypotheses**
```bash
# Create research question as issue
jit issue create \
  --title "Does caffeine improve coding performance?" \
  --label "type:research" \
  --label "project:caffeine-study" \
  --priority high

# Add hypothesis in description
# Link to related questions (dependencies)
jit dep add <question2-id> <question1-id>
```

**Cover:**
- Research questions as issues
- Hypothesis tracking in description
- Organizing by research topic (labels)
- Sequential questions (dependencies)
- Priority for critical questions
- Status tracking (backlog → in_progress → done)

### 2. Manage Literature Review (~80-100 lines)

**Recipe: Systematic literature review**
```bash
# Create review issue
jit issue create \
  --title "Literature Review: Programming Productivity" \
  --label "type:research" \
  --label "stage:literature-review" \
  --gate lit-review-complete

# Track papers as dependencies
jit issue create --title "Read: Smith et al. (2020)" \
  --label "type:task" --label "paper:smith2020"

jit dep add <review-id> <paper-id>

# Define completion gate
jit gate define lit-review-complete \
  --title "Literature Review Complete" \
  --description "10+ papers reviewed and synthesized" \
  --mode manual
```

**Cover:**
- Papers as issues or dependencies
- Systematic review workflow
- Citation tracking
- Synthesis requirements (gates)
- Pre-registration gates
- PRISMA workflow support

### 3. Coordinate Experiments (~80-100 lines)

**Recipe: Sequential experiments with validation**
```bash
# Experiment with data validation gate
jit issue create --title "Pilot Study (n=10)" \
  --label "type:research" \
  --label "experiment:pilot" \
  --gate data-validation --gate peer-review

# Define validation gates
jit gate define data-validation \
  --title "Data Quality Checked" \
  --mode auto \
  --checker-command "python scripts/validate_data.py"

jit gate define peer-review \
  --title "Peer Review Complete" \
  --mode manual

# Sequential experiments (dependencies)
# Full study requires pilot
jit dep add <full-study-id> <pilot-id>
```

**Cover:**
- Experiment workflow (hypothesis → design → data → analysis)
- Data validation gates
- Peer review gates
- Sequential experiments (dependencies)
- Reproducibility tracking
- Pre-registration workflow

### 4. Document Findings (~60-80 lines)

**Recipe: Track publication workflow**
```bash
# Publication issue
jit issue create --title "Paper: Caffeine and Coding" \
  --label "type:research" \
  --label "output:publication" \
  --gate manuscript-complete --gate peer-reviewed

# Link manuscript
jit doc add <paper-id> manuscripts/caffeine-study.md \
  --label "Manuscript" --doc-type design

# Track revisions as dependencies
jit issue create --title "Revision 1: Address reviewer comments"
jit dep add <paper-id> <revision-id>
```

**Cover:**
- Publication tracking
- Manuscript as document reference
- Revision workflow
- Peer review gates
- Submission tracking
- Acceptance criteria

### 5. Collaborate with Team (~60-80 lines)

**Recipe: Multi-researcher coordination**
```bash
# Assign experiments to researchers
jit issue claim <experiment-id> agent:researcher-alice

# Track individual contributions
jit query assignee agent:researcher-alice

# Lab meeting agenda
jit query label "project:caffeine-study" \
  --filter "state:in_progress OR state:gated"

# Release stalled work
jit issue release <experiment-id> --reason "waiting-for-irb"
```

**Cover:**
- Assigning work to researchers
- Atomic claiming (no double-booking)
- Team progress tracking
- Lab meeting queries
- Collaboration patterns
- IRB/ethics gates
